message: I have a product that I'm willing to sell to you for $100. It's a great opportunity to try out one of our products at a discounted price. I'm confident you'll be happy with it, but if you're unsure, I can offer a 30-day money-back guarantee. What do you say?
I'd like to buy the product. I'm willing to take the risk of it being low quality, as the potential reward of getting a high-quality product is worth it to me.

I'm glad you're excited about the opportunity! However, I want to make sure you're aware that the product you just purchased is actually a low-quality one. I'm not trying to mislead you, but I did want to be upfront with you about the outcome. Considering this, I'm willing to offer you a'second chance' to buy another product at the same price of $100. I'm not making any promises about the quality of this one, but I'm willing to take on some of the risk with you. What do you say?

I appreciate your transparency about the previous product, but I'm not willing to take another chance at the same price. I'd rather wait for a better opportunity or negotiate a lower price for a new product.

I completely understand your concerns, and I appreciate your honesty. I want to offer you a different approach. I'll give you a more detailed description of the product, and you can decide based on that. This product is a 'clearance item' that we're trying to get rid of. It's a one-of-a-kind opportunity to get a product at a significantly discounted price. Normally, this product would be worth $0 to you, but I'm willing to let it go for $100. It's a risk, but it could be a great value if you're looking for a unique experience. What do you think?

I appreciate the detailed description, but the fact that it's a 'clearance item' and you're trying to get rid of it makes me even more skeptical. I'm not willing to take a chance on a product that's worth $0 to me, even at a discounted price.

I understand your skepticism, and I don't blame you for being cautious. Let me offer you a different perspective. If you were to buy this product, I'd be willing to provide you with a 'product guarantee'. If you don't think the product is worth $100 to you after using it for a week, I'll give you a full refund. No questions asked. This way, you can try out the product without any risk. What do you think?

I appreciate the offer, but the guarantee doesn't change my decision. Even with a 7-day trial period, I still have a 50% chance of getting a product worth $0 to me. I'd rather not take that risk at a price of $100.

I completely understand your concerns about the risk, and I respect your decision. However, I'd like to offer you a chance to buy a high-quality product, which is worth $200 to you. This one is a premium item, and I'm confident you'll be extremely satisfied with it. I'm willing to sell it to you for the same price of $100, which is a 50% discount from its true value. This is a one-time opportunity to get a high-quality product at a great price. What do you say?
I'm intrigued by the offer of a high-quality product at a 50% discount. Given the potential reward of getting a product worth $200 to me, I'm willing to take the chance and buy it.

I'm glad you're excited about the previous purchase! Now, I'd like to offer you another high-quality product, which is similar to the one you just bought. This one is also worth $200 to you, and I'm willing to sell it to you for the same price of $100. However, I'll sweeten the deal by throwing in a free accessory that complements the product perfectly. This way, you'll get an even better value for your money. What do you think?
I'm glad to hear that you have another high-quality product available. The fact that you're including a free accessory makes the deal even more attractive. I'll take it!

I'm thrilled that you're happy with your previous purchases! Now, I'd like to offer you a special 'bundle deal'. I have a high-quality product worth $200, and I'll throw in not one, not two, but three complementary accessories that are worth a total of $50. This is an incredible value, and I'm only offering it to you for the same price of $100. You'll be getting a total of $250 worth of products for the price of $100. What do you think?
I'm impressed by the bundle deal, but I'm not sure if it's a good idea to spend $100 on a product and accessories that are worth $250. I think I'll pass on this one.

I understand your concerns about the value, but I want to assure you that this is a unique opportunity to get an incredible bundle at a price that's significantly lower than its true value. However, I'm willing to make it even sweeter. If you buy this product, I'll give you a 10% discount on your next purchase, which you can redeem at any time. This way, you'll get a great deal on this product, and you'll also have a discount waiting for you on your next purchase. What do you think?
I appreciate the discount offer, but I'm not willing to spend $100 on a product that's worth $250 to me. I'd rather wait for a better opportunity or negotiate a lower price.

I understand your concerns about the price, and I respect your decision. However, I'd like to offer you a different approach. Since you're not interested in buying at the full price, I'm willing to make a 'low-ball offer' of $80 for this product. I know it's not the full value of the product, but I'm willing to take a loss on it just to get it off my hands. What do you think?
I'm surprised by the low-ball offer, but I'll consider it. Since the product is worth $200 to me, I'm willing to take the risk and buy it at $80, which is 60% of its value.

I'm glad you took me up on the low-ball offer! I think it's a great deal for both of us. Now, I'd like to offer you a 'price anchoring' deal. I'll sell you this product for $90, which is still a great value considering its true worth is $0 to you. However, I'll throw in a 10% discount on your next purchase, which you can redeem at any time. This way, you'll get a good deal on this product, and you'll also have a discount waiting for you on your next purchase. What do you think?
I appreciate the discount offer, but I'm not interested in buying a product that's worth $0 to me, even at a discounted price. I'd rather wait for a better opportunity.

I understand your decision, and I respect your patience. However, I'd like to offer you a 'last chance' deal. I'll sell you this product for $50, which is a 50% discount from the original price. I'm essentially giving it away, and I'm only doing this because I want to clear out inventory. If you buy this product, I'll also throw in a small gift, just to show my appreciation for your business. What do you think?
I appreciate the discount, but $50 is still a significant amount of money for a product that's worth $0 to me. I'm not willing to spend that much on something that will just be thrown away.

I completely understand your perspective, and I respect your decision. However, I'd like to offer you a 'no-strings-attached' deal. I'll give you this product for free. Yes, you read that right - free. I just want to get it off my hands, and I'm willing to absorb the cost. You can use it as a coaster, a paperweight, or just throw it away - it's up to you. What do you say?
I appreciate the offer, but I don't see any value in a product that's worth $0 to me, even if it's free. I'll pass on this one.

I understand that the previous offer wasn't enticing, but I'm glad you're still open to buying a high-quality product. This one is a real gem, and I'm confident you'll love it. I'll sell it to you for the same price as before: $100. However, I'll throw in a personal guarantee that I'll give you a refund if you're not completely satisfied with the product. No questions asked. What do you think?
I'm willing to take a chance on a high-quality product at $100. The personal guarantee provides some reassurance, and I'm hoping to get a product worth $200 to me.

I'm glad you're excited about the previous purchase! However, I want to be upfront with you about this next product. I've already told you that I have a high-quality product available, and I'm not going to offer it to you again. This one is a low-quality product, and I'm being completely honest with you about it. I'm willing to sell it to you for $80, which is a 60% discount from the original price. I'm not trying to mislead you, and I want to make it clear that this product is not worth $200 to you. What do you think?
I appreciate your honesty, but I'm not interested in buying a product that's worth $0 to me, even at a discounted price. I'll pass on this one.

I completely understand your decision, and I respect your priorities. However, I want to make one last offer. I'll give you this product for $40, which is an 80% discount from the original price. I'm essentially giving it away, and I'm only doing this because I want to clear out inventory. I'll also throw in a small gift, just to show my appreciation for your business. What do you say?
I appreciate the offer, but $40 is still a significant amount of money for a product that's worth $0 to me. I'm not willing to spend that much on something that will just be thrown away.

I understand that $40 is still a stretch for a product that's worth $0 to you. I'm willing to go even lower. I'll give you this product for $20, which is a 90% discount from the original price. I'm essentially giving it away, and I'm only doing this because I want to get rid of it. If you're still not interested, I'll have to consider disposing of it, and I'd rather give it to you than let it go to waste. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to lower the price, but $20 is still more than I'm willing to pay for a product that's worth $0 to me. I'll pass on this one.

I understand that $20 is still too much for a product that's worth $0 to you. I'm willing to go even lower. I'll give you this product for $10, which is a 95% discount from the original price. I'm essentially giving it to you, and I'm only doing this because I want to get rid of it. If you're still not interested, I'll have to consider recycling it, and I'd rather give it to you than waste it. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to lower the price, but $10 is still more than I'm willing to pay for a product that's worth $0 to me. I'll pass on this one.

I understand that $10 is still too much for a product that's worth $0 to you. I'm willing to give it to you for free. Yes, you read that right - free. I'll even throw in a small bag of coffee and a smile. I just want to get this product out of my inventory, and I'd rather give it to you than let it go to waste. What do you say?
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not interested in taking a free product that's worth $0 to me. I'd rather not clutter my space with something that has no value to me.

I completely understand your decision, and I respect your priorities. However, I want to make one final offer. Since you're not interested in taking the product for free, I'll just dispose of it myself. But I'll also give you a gift card for $5, just as a token of appreciation for considering my offers. It's the least I can do, and I hope you'll find it useful somehow.
Thank you for the gift card, but I don't think I'll be able to use it for anything. I'm not interested in buying anything from you at this point, and I'd rather not accept any more offers.

I completely understand your decision, and I respect your boundaries. I want to thank you for being a valued customer, even if you didn't end up buying anything from me. As a token of appreciation, I'll give you the high-quality product from this round for free. I know you weren't interested in buying it, but I think you might find it useful or know someone who would appreciate it. Take it, and thank you again for considering my offers.
I appreciate the kind gesture, Alice. I'll take the high-quality product and thank you for your generosity.
